An Alfred Workflow for Apple Shortcuts

#!/bin/zsh
# Get an alphabetic list of shortcuts strsclist=$(shortcuts list|sort -f)
# Build the basic JSON content jsonsclist="$(echo $strsclist | sed -r 's/(.*)/{"title" : "\1", "arg" : "\1"},/')REMOVELASTCOMMA" # Strip the last comma (and the end of list marker) jsonsclist=$(echo $jsonsclist | sed -r 's/,REMOVELASTCOMMA//')
# Output the JSON echo {\"items\": [ echo $jsonsclist echo "]}"

Copy URL to Run Shortcut from Folder
Shortcut names by folder including counts and no folder

#!/bin/zsh
# Get an alphabetic list of Shortcuts folders strscflist=$(shortcuts list --folders | sort -f)
# Build the basic JSON content jsonscflist="$(echo $strscflist | sed -r 's/(.*)/{"title" : "\1", "arg" : "\1"},/')REMOVELASTCOMMA" # Strip the last comma (and the end of list marker) jsonscflist=$(echo $jsonscflist | sed -r 's/,REMOVELASTCOMMA//')
# Output the JSON echo {\"items\": [ echo $jsonscflist echo "]}"
Select a Shortcuts folder to filter with
Copy URL to Run Shortcut from Folder with Input

# NOTE: Output is Markdown formatted with level 1 headings and bulleted list items
# Get a list of all Shortcuts folders (alphabetically) strFolders=$(shortcuts list --folders | sort -f)
# Get a list of all shortcuts strAllShortcuts=$(shortcuts list)
# Explicitly initialise strShortcutsInFolders=
# For each folder output the details and append the names for strFolder (${(f)strFolders}) do # Get the shortcuts in the folder (alphabetically) strShortcutsInThisFolder=$(shortcuts list --folder-name "$strFolder" | sort -f)
# Output their names and a shortcut count if [ -z "$strShortcutsInThisFolder" ] then echo \# $strFolder "(0)" else echo \# $strFolder "($(echo $strShortcutsInThisFolder | wc -l | awk '{$1=$1};1'))" echo $strShortcutsInThisFolder | sed -r 's/(.*)/- \1/' fi echo
# Append them strShortcutsInFolders=$strShortcutsInFolders\\n$strShortcutsInThisFolder done
# From the list of all shortcuts, remove all the ones we just found in folders # We'll also alphabetically sort them strRootShortcuts=$(echo $strAllShortcuts\\n$strShortcutsInFolders | sort -f | uniq -u)
# Output details of the shortcuts not in a folder (including a shortcut count) if [ -z "$strShortcutsInThisFolder" ] then echo \# \{NO FOLDER\} "(0)" else echo \# \{NO FOLDER\} "($(echo $strRootShortcuts | wc -l | awk '{$1=$1};1'))" echo $strRootShortcuts | sed -r 's/(.*)/- \1/' fi echo
# Output a grand total echo \# TOTAL "($(echo $strAllShortcuts | wc -l | awk '{$1=$1};1'))"

Copy Shell Command to Run Shortcut
on run argv display dialog "Please install the icon extractor shortcut." buttons {"Get Shortcut"} default button "Get Shortcut" with icon caution end run

query=$1
shortcuts list | grep "$SaveShortcutIcons" | wc -l | awk '{$1=$1};1'

Help sites related to Bypass and Shortcuts

#!/bin/zsh
# Get an alphabetic list of shortcuts strsclist=$(shortcuts list|sort -f)
# Build the basic JSON content jsonsclist="$(echo $strsclist | sed -r 's/(.*)/{"title" : "\1", "arg" : "\1"},/')REMOVELASTCOMMA" # Strip the last comma (and the end of list marker) jsonsclist=$(echo $jsonsclist | sed -r 's/,REMOVELASTCOMMA//')
# Output the JSON echo {\"items\": [ echo $jsonsclist echo "]}"
Copy AppleScript Code to Run Shortcut
tell application "Shortcuts Events" set returnValue to run shortcut "{query}" return returnValue end tell

# Build the basic JSON content jsonscflist="$(echo $strscflist | sed -r 's/(.*)/{"title" : "\1", "arg" : "\1"},/')REMOVELASTCOMMA" # Strip the last comma (and the end of list marker) jsonscflist=$(echo $jsonscflist | sed -r 's/,REMOVELASTCOMMA//')
# Output the JSON echo {\"items\": [ echo $jsonscflist echo "]}"
Select a Shortcuts folder to filter with
Paste AppleScript Code to Run Shortcut from Folder with Input
tell application "Shortcuts Events" set returnValue to run shortcut "{var:shortcut2run}" with input "{query}" return returnValue end tell

Paste URL to Run Shortcut with Input
Enter the bundle ID for the workflow containing the external trigger
Enter the name of the External Trigger

# This builds an open command to run the AppleScript app that runs the Alfred external call - seemingly a necessity for the security confirmation to enable the Stream Deck to call an external call.
# If we are outputting to a Stream Deck field, we can drop the 'open' command as that gets automatically prepended by the "System: open: action. if [[ "$focusedApp" != "com.elgato.StreamDeck" ]] then echo -n "open " fi
# Output the details for runnign the flow. echo -n \"$alfred_preferences/workflows/$alfred_workflow_uid/alfred_external.app\" --args \"$externalTrigger\" \"$bundleID\"

#!/bin/zsh
# Get an alphabetic list of shortcuts strsclist=$(shortcuts list|sort -f)
# Build the basic JSON content jsonsclist="$(echo $strsclist | sed -r 's/(.*)/{"title" : "\1", "arg" : "\1"},/')REMOVELASTCOMMA" # Strip the last comma (and the end of list marker) jsonsclist=$(echo $jsonsclist | sed -r 's/,REMOVELASTCOMMA//')
# Output the JSON echo {\"items\": [ echo $jsonsclist echo "]}"
Paste PopClip Extension Install Script to Run Shortcut
echo "#popclip" echo "name: \"$(echo $1)\"" echo "icon: \"$(echo $1 | cut -c1)\"" echo "shortcut name: \"$(echo $1)\""

Bypass is an Alfred workflow for working with Apple's Shortcuts app. Its primary purpose is to allow you to launch your Shortcuts workflows (known as shortcuts) from Alfred, potentially even passing in content to be processed. It also supports a number of other functions to help you work with and trigger shortcuts. Bypass contains a number of keyword, external trigger, snippet and universal action triggers to enable this functionality.
## Documentation - https://thoughtasylum.com/alfred/alfred_bypass_for_shortcuts/

Enables automatic extraction of Shortcuts icons when using the Elgato Stream Deck functionality.

The name of the Apple Shortcut to run when carrying out an icon extraction. Only change this if you have a specific alternative shortcut to run or have renamed the original shortcut.
For further details, such as where to download the shortcut, visit the documentation link listed in the 'about this workflow' area.
